page.title: 12RECREATION - quarry walks
page.content: A favourite walk from the town of Hartlepool is to the disused quarry which lies beside Brierton Farms. The quarry is privately owned and has not been used as a quarry for a number of years. It should still be entered only with permission but sadly it has become something of a tip. The father of one pupil had visited the quarry now and then for twenty three years and told us two things he remembered about it. First he recalled a time when the quarry had quite deep pools and was the home for newts , frogs, tadpoles and toads. Now the quarry is mostly dry. Second he remembered seeing there a small inhabited building which has now disappeared. Today the quarry is used most by budding trials riders on bikes.
